newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber mixed despite inquiries.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber mixed despite inquiries.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were mixed at noon session with SMR prices sliding because of the poor performance of the Tokyo market, brokers said.

"The market was slow this morning. There were some inquiries from Iran and China for SMR 20 rubber. Sellers are seen offering 259 and 260 cents for July shipment but buyers want to buy at 258 cents," a trader said.
He said any deals would be known later in the day.
Some dealers said there were some shortcovering by European buyers ahead of the approaching summer holidays.

At midday close, Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quoted July RSS1 buyer at 282.50 cents ($1.12) a kg, up half a cent from Tuesday's close. But June SMR 20 buyer slipped half a cent to 260 cents.
A Malaysia-based shipping agent quoted freight rates for rubber from Malaysia to Rotterdam at $800 per TEU (or 20-ft container), and $1,700 per two-TEU containers (or 40-ft container).
